result.title: A set of calibrated BEM for real demonstration cases and proposed standardisation
result.description: This deliverable presents the results of BEM calibration from the demonstration cases for the purpose of simulation and further analysis. The BEMs will be produced and improved continuously from M13 to M36. The deliverable also includes the lessons-learned from BEM calibration as input for standardisation in WP5/Task 5.1.

result.title: Battery storage and EV charger (Task 5.3.4, Month 40)
result.description: A battery energy system integrated into a power electronics circuit will be installed in the Netherlands in a controlled environment to provide various flexible functions like congestion management, power quality and other functions studied in this task. The theoretical research will be verified and validated in this demonstration site during the course of this project.

result.title: New return channels with 100 return points
result.description: A key cost component in the RePack system are the fees from national postal operators for handling the return of used RePack’s. The cost of return logisticscan be significantly reduced through new, alternative return logistics channels. These include in-store returns or returns through existing recycling systems, such as those set up for the Packaging ordinance and extended producer responsibility in packaging. New return channels enable scalable growth by increasing the number of return points and lowering the costs for a key component in the business model.Task 1.1 includes setting up alternative return logistics channels through identifying potential partners for in-store returns (existing & new customers) or through existing EPR channels (such as Grune Punkt, Citeo, etc.) and promoting them to customers.The result is a network of established in-store return channels with at least 30 return points by M12 and at least 100 collection points by M24.
